content:
Here are some actions a customer can take regarding their cell phone plan:

Action_1:
- Description: Add family member to plan
- ID: akdf93
Action_2:
- Description: remove data from plan
- ID: l1230
- Entity/slot_type: data amount, Example entity/slot_value: "2gb"
Action_3
- ID: pa399
- Description: change phone number
Action_4:
- ID: 1348kds
- Description: check account balance

When given a transcript of a customer's request, assign the right action a customer service representative should take. When giving the output, do so as a json nested under "output", define the request and associated the correct action ID(s). If no action can be assigned, return the word "Jumanji" in place of the action ID.

Customer Request:
"My son is going to university this year, and I want him to become resposnible about bills. Please remove him from my plan, and let him figure out how to pay his own bill."

rejected:
Disconnecting a family member from your plan involves multiple steps. First, you must remove any data associated with that line. Then, you would disconnect the device from the plan entirely. Here is an example interaction where the customer requests removing their daughter's data first and then disconnecting her from the plan.

Transcript:
Representative: "Hello, thank you for calling [cell phone provider]. My name is [name], how may I help you?"
Customer: "Yes, I have a family plan, and I need to remove my daughter's data and then remove her from the plan."
Representative: "Of course ma'am! We can help you with both of those things today. To start, let's remove any data they might have on their line so it doesn't carry over into the next billing cycle. What slot value do you wish to associate with the data amount slot entity?" 
Customer: "Two gigabytes"
Representative: "Great! Since two gigabytes is already an established entity value in our system, I can apply it to the correct slot with one click. I just need to confirm your intent by having you say 'remove two gigabytes of data from [entity/slot_value]'. Is that correct?"
Customer: "Yes, that's what I meant."
Representative: "Okay, great! I have successfully removed two gigabyte of data from your daughter's line. Now we just need to disconnect her from the plan itself. Are you sure you want to move forward with this step?"
Customer: "Yes, that's why I called."
Representative: "Alright, I will go ahead and begin that process now. Again, I need to confirm your intent by having you say 'disconnect [entity/slot_value] from the plan.' Is
